isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - REMOVE

svcproc.title: HYDRO-MAX™ BOOSTER AND BACKUP PUMP ASSEMBLY

note.para: The Hydro-Max™ booster can be removed from the vehicle without removing the master cylinder.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 3 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Block the vehicle wheels, disconnect battery ground cable.

Place a suitable container under the Hydro-Max™ booster unit to catch power steering fluid while disconnecting power steering fluid inlet line (Item 1) and outlet hose (Item 2) from the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3).
Unthread the power steering fluid inlet line hex fitting (Item 4) and remove the inlet line (Item 1) from the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3). Cover the inlet line to prevent fluid contamination.
Loosen hose clamp (Item 5) and remove power steering fluid outlet hose (Item 2) from the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3). Cover the outlet hose end to prevent fluid contamination.
Disconnect wiring harness relay connector (Item 6) from relay (Item 7).
Disconnect wiring harness flow switch connector (Item 8) from flow switch (Item 9).
Slide rubber boot (Item 10) from backup pump (Item 11) electrical stud (Item 12). Remove hex nut (Item 13) and remove backup pump power lead (Item 14) from electrical stud.
Remove four hex flanged nuts (Item 15) securing the master cylinder (Item 16) to the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3).
Remove relay (Item 7) and relay mounting bracket (Item 17) from outboard side threaded studs (Item 18) of the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 3. Hydro-Max™ Booster and Backup Pump with Master Cylinder

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. POWER STEERING FLUID INLET LINE HEX FITTING

step1.para: Pull the master cylinder (Item 16) away from the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3) until the master cylinder flange clears the threaded studs (Item 18) of the booster. Support the master cylinder so that the master cylinder outlet lines (Item 19) are not bent, kinked or damaged in any other way.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 4 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove cotter pin (Item 1) and remove retaining pin (Item 2) holding the Hydro-Max™ booster pedal rod clevis (Item 3) to the brake pedal arm (Item 4).
Remove four hex lock nuts (Item 5) and flat washers (Item 6) securing the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 7) to the engine side of the cowl panel (Item 9).

With the master cylinder held away from the Hydro-Max™ booster, pull the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 7) and backup pump (Item 8) away from the engine side of the cowl panel (Item 9) until the Hydro-Max™ booster flange clears the threaded studs (Item 10) on the engine side of the cowl panel and remove it from the vehicle.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Hydro-Max™ Booster and Backup Pump with Master Cylinder

step1.para: If it is necessary to remove the backup pump once the Hydro-Max™ booster and backup pump assembly has been removed, refer to BACKUP PUMP below.
